addToClientDataDefinition

public void addToClientDataDefinition(int dataDefineID,
                                      int offset,
                                      int size)
                               throws java.io.IOException
The addToClientDataDefinition function is used to add an offset and a size in bytes, to a client data definition.

This function must be called before a client data area can be written to or read from. Typically this function would be called once for each variable that is going to be read or written. Note that an error will not be given if the size of a data definition exceeds the size of the client area - this is to allow for the case where definitions are specified by one client before the relevant client area is created by another.

Whereas data definitions for client areas are defined in bytes, it is anticipated that most clients will write in specific data types, and cast appropriately when the data is received.

Parameters:
dataDefineID - Specifies the ID of the client-defined client data definition.
offset - the offset into the client area, where the new addition is to start.
size - the size of the new addition, in bytes.
Throws:
java.io.IOException
See Also:
createClientData(int, int, boolean), clearClientDataDefinition(int), mapClientDataNameToID(String, int), setClientData(int, int, int, int, int, byte[]), requestClientData(int, int, int, int, int)

addToClientDataDefinition

public void addToClientDataDefinition(int dataDefineID,
                                      int offset,
                                      int size,
                                      int reserved)
                               throws java.io.IOException
The addToClientDataDefinition function is used to add an offset and a size in bytes, to a client data definition.

This function must be called before a client data area can be written to or read from. Typically this function would be called once for each variable that is going to be read or written. Note that an error will not be given if the size of a data definition exceeds the size of the client area - this is to allow for the case where definitions are specified by one client before the relevant client area is created by another.

Whereas data definitions for client areas are defined in bytes, it is anticipated that most clients will write in specific data types, and cast appropriately when the data is received.

Parameters:
dataDefineID - Specifies the ID of the client-defined client data definition.
offset - the offset into the client area, where the new addition is to start.
size - the size of the new addition, in bytes.
reserved - Reserved for future use
Throws:
java.io.IOException
See Also:
createClientData(int, int, boolean), clearClientDataDefinition(int), mapClientDataNameToID(String, int), setClientData(int, int, int, int, int, byte[]), requestClientData(int, int, int, int, int)

addToClientDataDefinition

public void addToClientDataDefinition(int dataDefineID,
                                      int offset,
                                      int sizeOrType,
                                      float epsilon,
                                      int datumId)
                               throws java.io.IOException
The addToClientDataDefinition function is used to add an offset and a size in bytes, to a client data definition.

This function must be called before a client data area can be written to or read from. Typically this function would be called once for each variable that is going to be read or written. Note that an error will not be given if the size of a data definition exceeds the size of the client area - this is to allow for the case where definitions are specified by one client before the relevant client area is created by another.

Parameters:
dataDefineID - Specifies the ID of the client-defined client data definition.
offset - the offset into the client area, where the new addition is to start. Set this to SimConnectConstants.CLIENTDATAOFFSET_AUTO for the offsets to be calculated by the SimConnect server.
sizeOrType - Double word containing either the size of the client data in bytes, or one of the predefined values
epsilon - If data is requested only when it changes (see the flags parameter of requestClientData(int, int, int, ClientDataPeriod, int, int, int, int) a change will only be reported if it is greater than the value of this parameter (not greater than or equal to). The default is zero, so even the tiniest change will initiate the transmission of data. Set this value appropriately so insignificant changes are not transmitted. This can be used with integer data, the floating point epsilon value is first truncated to its integer component before the comparison is made (for example, an epsilon value of 2.9 truncates to 2, so a data change of 2 will not trigger a transmission, and a change of 3 will do so). This parameter only applies if one of the six constant values listed above has been set in the sizeOrType parameter, if a size has been specified SimConnect has no record of the type of data being sent, so cannot do a meaningful comparison of values.
datumId - Specifies a client defined datum ID. The default is zero. Use this to identify the data received if the data is being returned in tagged format (see the flags parameter of requestClientData(int, int, int, ClientDataPeriod, int, int, int, int). There is no need to specify datum IDs if the data is not being returned in tagged format.
Throws:
java.io.IOException
{@link - UnsupportedOperationException} Invalid emulated protocol version (needed v3)
Since:
0.5
See Also:
createClientData(int, int, boolean), clearClientDataDefinition(int), mapClientDataNameToID(String, int), setClientData(int, int, int, int, int, byte[]), requestClientData(int, int, int, int, int)

addToClientDataDefinition

public void addToClientDataDefinition(java.lang.Enum dataDefineID,
                                      int offset,
                                      int sizeOrType,
                                      float epsilon,
                                      int datumId)
                               throws java.io.IOException
The addToClientDataDefinition function is used to add an offset and a size in bytes, to a client data definition.

This function must be called before a client data area can be written to or read from. Typically this function would be called once for each variable that is going to be read or written. sizeOrType - Double word containing either the size of the client data in bytes, or one of the predefined values
epsilon - If data is requested only when it changes (see the flags parameter of requestClientData(int, int, int, ClientDataPeriod, int, int, int, int) a change will only be reported if it is greater than the value of this parameter (not greater than or equal to). The default is zero, so even the tiniest change will initiate the transmission of data. Set this value appropriately so insignificant changes are not transmitted. This can be used with integer data, the floating point epsilon value is first truncated to its integer component before the comparison is made (for example, an epsilon value of 2.9 truncates to 2, so a data change of 2 will not trigger a transmission, and a change of 3 will do so). This parameter only applies if one of the six constant values listed above has been set in the sizeOrType parameter, if a size has been specified SimConnect has no record of the type of data being sent, so cannot do a meaningful comparison of values.

There is no need to specify datum IDs if the data is not being returned in tagged format.

requestClientData

public void requestClientData(int clientDataID,
                              int dataRequestID,
                              int clientDataDefineID)
                       throws java.io.IOException
Request that the specified data in an area created by another client be sent to this client.

Parameters:
clientDataID - Specifies the ID of the client data area. Before calling this function for the first time on one client area, call mapClientDataNameToID(String, int) to map an ID to the unique client data area name. This name must match the name specified by the client creating the data area with the mapClientDataNameToID(String, int) and createClientData(int, int, boolean).
dataRequestID - Specifies the ID of the client-defined request. This is used later by the client to identify which data has been received. This value should be unique for each request, re-using a RequestID will overwrite any previous request using the same ID.
clientDataDefineID - Specifies the ID of the client-defined data definition. This definition specifies the data that should be sent to the client.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Standard IO failure
See Also:
requestClientData(int, int, int, int, int), addToClientDataDefinition(int, int, int, int), requestClientData(int, int, int, int, int), mapClientDataNameToID(String, int), createClientData(int, int, boolean)

requestClientData

public void requestClientData(int clientDataID,
                              int dataRequestID,
                              int clientDataDefineID,
                              int reserved1,
                              int reserved2)
                       throws java.io.IOException
Request that the specified data in an area created by another client be sent to this client.

Parameters:
clientDataID - Specifies the ID of the client data area. Before calling this function for the first time on one client area, call mapClientDataNameToID(String, int) to map an ID to the unique client data area name. This name must match the name specified by the client creating the data area with the mapClientDataNameToID(String, int) and createClientData(int, int, boolean).
dataRequestID - Specifies the ID of the client-defined request. This is used later by the client to identify which data has been received. This value should be unique for each request, re-using a RequestID will overwrite any previous request using the same ID.
clientDataDefineID - Specifies the ID of the client-defined data definition. This definition specifies the data that should be sent to the client.
reserved1 - Reserved for future use.
reserved2 - Reserved for future use.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Standard IO failure
See Also:

requestClientData

public void requestClientData(int clientDataID,
                              int dataRequestID,
                              int clientDataDefineID,
                              ClientDataPeriod period,
                              int flags,
                              int origin,
                              int interval,
                              int limit)
                       throws java.io.IOException
Request that the specified data in an area created by another client be sent to this client.

Parameters:
clientDataID - Specifies the ID of the client data area. Before calling this function for the first time on one client area, call mapClientDataNameToID(String, int) to map an ID to the unique client data area name. This name must match the name specified by the client creating the data area with the mapClientDataNameToID(String, int) and createClientData(int, int, boolean).
dataRequestID - Specifies the ID of the client-defined request. This is used later by the client to identify which data has been received. This value should be unique for each request, re-using a RequestID will overwrite any previous request using the same ID.
clientDataDefineID - Specifies the ID of the client-defined data definition. This definition specifies the data that should be sent to the client.
period - One member of the SimConnectPeriod enumeration type, specifying how often the data is to be sent by the server and received by the client.
flags - A flag SimConnectConstants.CLIENT_DATA_REQUEST_FLAG_CHANGED or SimConnectConstants.CLIENT_DATA_REQUEST_FLAG_DEFAULT or SimConnectConstants.CLIENT_DATA_REQUEST_FLAG_TAGGED
origin - The number of Period events that should elapse before transmission of the data begins. The default is zero, which means transmissions will start immediately.
interval - The number of Period events that should elapse between transmissions of the data. The default is zero, which means the data is transmitted every Period
limit - The number of times the data should be transmitted before this communication is ended. The default is zero, which means the data should be transmitted endlessly.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Standard IO failure
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the emulated protocol version is too low (need 0x3)
Since:
0.5
See Also:
requestClientData(int, int, int, int, int), addToClientDataDefinition(int, int, int, int), requestClientData(int, int, int, int, int), mapClientDataNameToID(String, int), createClientData(int, int, boolean), clearClientDataDefinition(int)

requestClientData

public void requestClientData(java.lang.Enum clientDataID,
                              java.lang.Enum dataRequestID,
                              java.lang.Enum clientDataDefineID,
                              ClientDataPeriod period,
                              int flags,
                              int origin,
                              int interval,
                              int limit)
                       throws java.io.IOException

clientDataDefineID - Specifies the ID of the client-defined data definition. This definition specifies the data that should be sent to the client.
period - One member of the SimConnectPeriod enumeration type, specifying how often the data is to be sent by the server and received by the client.
flags - A flag SimConnectConstants.CLIENT_DATA_REQUEST_FLAG_CHANGED or SimConnectConstants.CLIENT_DATA_REQUEST_FLAG_DEFAULT or SimConnectConstants.CLIENT_DATA_REQUEST_FLAG_TAGGED

setClientData

public void setClientData(int clientDataID,
                          int clientDataDefineID,
                          int reserved,
                          int arrayCount,
                          int unitSize,
                          byte[] data)
                   throws java.io.IOException
Write one or more units of data to a client data area.

Parameters:
clientDataID - Specifies the ID of the client data area.
clientDataDefineID - Specifies the ID of the client defined client data definition.
reserved - Reserved for future use. Set to zero.
arrayCount - Reserved for future use. Set to zero.
unitSize - Specifies the size of the data set in bytes. The server will check that this size matches exactly the size of the data definition provided in the DefineID parameter. An exception will be returned if this is not the case.
data - data to be written
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Standard IO failure
See Also:
addToClientDataDefinition(int, int, int, int), clearClientDataDefinition(int), createClientData(int, int, boolean), mapClientDataNameToID(String, int), requestClientData(int, int, int, int, int)

                       java.lang.String description,

                throws java.io.IOException

text

public void text(int type,
                 float timeSeconds,
                 int eventId,
                 java.lang.String message)
          throws java.io.IOException,
                 java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
The text function is used to display a text menu, or scrolling or static text, on the screen.

Parameters:
type - One member of the TextType enumeration type.
timeSeconds - The timeout value for the text or menu, in seconds. If zero is entered, the text or menu will not timeout. For text only, this timeout value can be overridden if there are other text requests waiting in the queue
eventId - Specifies the client defined event ID, which will be returned along with the TextResult (in the data parameter) of a RecvEvent structure.
message - message to send
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this simconnect client protocol version is too old (requires v3)
Only one text and one menu request can appear on the screen at one time. Requests are queued as they are received, with only the topmost in the queue being displayed. There is one queue for menus and another for static and scrolling text. When a request is first displayed the TextResult.DISPLAYED event will be sent to the client. If a request joins the queue and cannot immediately be displayed the event TextResult.QUEUED will be sent. When it is the turn of the new request to be displayed the TextResult.DISPLAYED event will be sent. If the request is for a menu, and the user selects one f the menu entries, one of the TextResult.MENU_SELECT_1 events will be returned (see the TextResult enumeration), and the menu closed.
The default location for static or scrolling text is along the top of the screen. A user can move and resize the window that the text is being displayed in, but it is not possible to specify an alternative location for the text programmatically.
If the timeout requested exceeds the minimum display time, and another text request is waiting, the timeout value is overridden and the text will only be displayed for the minimum display time. The default minimum display time is two seconds for static text and 10 seconds for scrolling text. These can be changed in the [SimConnect] section of FSX.cfg file using the TextMinPrintTimeSeconds and TextMinScrollTimeSeconds settings.
java.io.IOException
Since:
0.5

                 java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException

Parameters:
type - One member of the TextType enumeration type.
timeSeconds - The timeout value for the text or menu, in seconds. If zero is entered, the text or menu will not timeout. For text only, this timeout value can be overridden if there are other text requests waiting in the queue
eventId - Specifies the client defined event ID, which will be returned along with the TextResult (in the data parameter) of a RecvEvent structure.
message - message to send
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this simconnect client protocol version is too old (requires v3)

There is one queue for menus and another for static and scrolling text. When a request is first displayed the TextResult.DISPLAYED event will be sent to the client. If a request joins the queue and cannot immediately be displayed the event TextResult.QUEUED will be sent. When it is the turn of the new request to be displayed the TextResult.DISPLAYED event will be sent. If the request is for a menu, and the user selects one f the menu entries, one of the TextResult.MENU_SELECT_1 events will be returned (see the TextResult enumeration), and the menu closed.
If the message is set to null, the text will be removed from with the queue, with a TextResult.REMOVED event being returned to the client
The default location for static or scrolling text is along the top of the screen. A user can move and resize the window that the text is being displayed in, but it is not possible to specify an alternative location for the text programmatically.
If the timeout requested exceeds the minimum display time, and another text request is waiting, the timeout value is overridden and the text will only be displayed for the minimum display time. The default minimum display time is two seconds for static text and 10 seconds for scrolling text. menu

public void menu(float timeSeconds,
                 int eventId,
                 java.lang.String title,
                 java.lang.String prompt,
                 java.lang.String... items)
          throws java.io.IOException,
                 java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
The text function is used to display a text menu.

Parameters:
timeSeconds - The timeout value for the menu, in seconds. If zero is entered, the menu will not timeout.
eventId - Specifies the client defined event ID, which will be returned along with the TextResult (in the data parameter) of a RecvEvent structure.
title - Menu title
prompt - Menu prompt
items - Menu items (maximum 10)
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this simconnect client protocol version is too old (requires v3)
Only one text and one menu request can appear on the screen at one time. Requests are queued as they are received, with only the topmost in the queue being displayed. There is one queue for menus and another for static and scrolling text. When a request is first displayed the TextResult.DISPLAYED event will be sent to the client. If a request joins the queue and cannot immediately be displayed the event TextResult.QUEUED will be sent. When it is the turn of the new request to be displayed the TextResult.DISPLAYED event will be sent. If the request is for a menu, and the user selects one f the menu entries, one of the TextResult.MENU_SELECT_1 events will be returned (see the TextResult enumeration), and the menu closed.
If all parameters (title, prompt and items) are set to null, the menu will be removed from with the queue, with a TextResult.REMOVED event being returned to the client
The default location for static or scrolling text is along the top of the screen. A user can move and resize the window that the text is being displayed in, but it is not possible to specify an alternative location for the text programmatically.
If the timeout requested exceeds the minimum display time, and another text request is waiting, the timeout value is overridden and the text will only be displayed for the minimum display time. The default minimum display time is two seconds for static text and 10 seconds for scrolling text. These can be changed in the [SimConnect] section of FSX.cfg file using the TextMinPrintTimeSeconds and TextMinScrollTimeSeconds settings.
java.io.IOException
Since:
0.5

requestFacilitiesList

public void requestFacilitiesList(FacilityListType type,
                                  int eventId)
                           throws java.io.IOException,
                                  java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
The requestFacilitiesList function is used to request a list of all the facilities of a given type currently held in the facilities cache.

Parameters:
type - Specifies one member of the FacilityListType enumeration type.
eventId - Specifies the client defined request ID. This will be returned along with the data.
Throws:
java.io.IOException
{@link - UnsupportedOperationException} if this simconnect client protocol version is too old (requires v3)
Flight Simulator X keeps a facilities cache of all the airports, waypoints, NDB and VOR stations within a certain radius of the user aircraft. This radius varies depending on where the aircraft is in the world, but is at least large enough to encompass the whole of the reality bubble for airports and waypoints, and can be over 200 miles for VOR and NDB stations. As the user aircraft moves facilities will be added to, and removed from, the cache. However, in the interests of performance, hysteresis is built into the system.
To receive event notifications when a facility is added, use the subscribeToFacilities(FacilityListType, int) function. When this function is first called, a full list from the cache will be sent, thereafter just the additions will be transmitted. No notification is given when a facility is removed from the cache. the Obviously to terminate these notifications use the unSubscribeToFacilities(FacilityListType) function.
When requesting types of facility information, one function call has to be made for each of the four types of data. The data will be returned in one of the four structures:
  • RecvAirportList, which will contain a list of FacilityAirport structures.
  • RecvNDBList, which will contain a list of FacilityNDB structures.
  • RecvVORList, which will contain a list of FacilityVOR structures.
  • RecvWaypointList, which will contain a list of FacilityWaypoint structures.
The four list structures inherit the data from the RecvFacilitiesList structure. Given that the list of returned facilities could be large, it may be split across several packets, and each packet must be interpreted separately by the client.
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
Since:
0.5

getProtocolVersion

public int getProtocolVersion()
Returns the version number of the emulated protocol. As of jsimconnect 0.7, returned values are
  • 0x2 (from FSX RTM)
  • 0x3 (from FSX SP1, supports enhanced client data, facilites, and modeless ui)
  • 0x4 (from FSX SP2/Acceleration, racing and another flight save

Returns:
emulated protocol version
Since:
0.7
